results.title: Laila
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Margaret Pettigrew and Diane Beaudry
results.brief_description: Laila Paattinen is a working woman. Tired of low-paying jobs, she completed a five-month course in dry-wall installation. Because she had chosen a non-traditional job for women, she ran into resistance in the marketplace. She finally solved her problems by opening her own dry-wall application business. A useful film for women seeking non-traditional jobs.

results.title: Lahaul and Spiti
results.creator_credit: Films Division, Government of India, Mohan Wadhwani and N.S. Thapa
results.brief_description: The mountains of Lahaul and Spiti are situated in the sparsely populated northern Punjab. Shows the people who live in the scattered towns and villages, their work, domestic life, festival and ceremonial dances. Buddhist monks live high in the mountains coming down on occasions to join with the villagers in religious ceremonies.

results.title: Lagged: the story of a convict
results.creator_credit: NIDA, John Clark and Henrietta Clark
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a boy convicted as a pick- pocket in London in 1792 and transported to Botany Bay for seven years. Consists entirely of graphics from the period using sepia-tint photographs and contemporary ballads and suggests that a convict in Australia was better off than a coal miner in England, at least up to 1836. Historical adviser, A.T. Yarwood. Voices by John Krummel, Norman Hodges, Alan Edwards. Written by John and Henrietta Clark and filmed by George Pashuk.

results.title: Lagaan: Once upon a time in India [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Aamir Khan Productions, Aamir Khan and Ashutosh Gowariker
results.brief_description: A major cinematic event in India, and one of the most expensive films to ever come out of Bollywood, “Lagaan”, is about a group of impoverished villagers whose land is ravaged by drought. Fearing penury as a result of high taxes, Bhuvan (Indian star Aamir Khan) appeals the military governor for a repreive who challenges the locals to a game of cricket. Despite the fact that none can play the game, the farmers rally to save their homes. With its rousing musical numbers, “Lagaan” also boasts impressive cinematography and splendid performances. Nominated for Best Foreign Film, at the Academy Awards. Cast includes: Aamir Khan, Gracy Singh, Rachel Shelley, Paul Blackthorne, and Suhasini Mulay. In Hindi with English subtitles.

results.title: Lady Windermere's fan
results.brief_description: Based on Oscar Wilde’s stage play about a woman who narrowly avoids causing a scandal in London society. The first and most melodramatic of his four social comedies, this silent film version was directed by former actor Fred Paul. It is a typical example of British feature films from this period with the actors giving essentially stage-crafted performances. Although the play was substantially altered for this screen version, it is still shot as if it was theatre with the camera taking up a fixed frontal position. A new specially commissioned musical soundtrack composed and conducted by Nicholas Brown and performed by the Triptych piano trio has been added. Cast includes Milton Rosmer, Netta Westcott and Nigel Playfair.

results.title: Lady stay dead
results.brief_description: A girl visits her film star sister in a beach resort only to discover clues to a macabre murder. A psychotic gardener preys on his female employers, murdering them in a variety of grisly ways.
results.description: A girl visits her film star sister in a beach resort only to discover clues to a macabre murder. A psychotic gardener preys on his female employers, murdering them in a variety of grisly ways.

results.title: Lady Reading and the W.V.S
results.creator_credit: Gerard Holdsworth Productions, Gerard Holdsworth and Gordon Hacks
results.brief_description: Lady Reading, head of the Women’s Voluntary Service, interviewed at her Surrey country home and at W.V.S. in London. She discusses welfare work with the old and the young, Civil Defence Service, providing clothes for refugees throughout the world, meals on wheels, and the motto of W.V.S. - “Not why we can’t, but how we can”. In the words of Lady Reading, the true measure of service is “service without measure”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerard Holdsworth Productions, Gerard Holdsworth and Gordon Hacks

results.title: Lady of the camelias = La Dame aux Camelias
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Les Films du Losange, Opera Film Produzione, Telemunchen, Margaret Menegoz, Manolo Bolognini and Mauro Bolognini
results.brief_description: Isabelle Huppert portrays the infamous Parisian courtesan Alphonsine Duplessis, mistress to the son of Alexander Dumas. Alphonsine, a country girl, was sold by her father to a wealthy neighbour, introducing her to a round of living in expansive palaces and keeping company with wealthy aristocrats and eventually Alexander Dumas himself. By the time she and Dumas meet she is suffering from tuberculosis, and her life story (from seamstress to prostitute to courtesan) becomes the inspiration for Dumas’ story of Camille. Her father then intervenes and denounces Dumas for romanticizing her life - the same father who sold her off in the first place. This lavish production tells the “true” story of her life and amorous adventures during the decadent period of the Second Empire. Original Italian version dubbed in English.

results.title: Lady beware
results.creator_credit: Julian Films, Julian Bercovici and Bruce Kerner
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the four basics of personal safety against criminal attack, showing how to secure oneself, avoid danger, knowing when to flee and engage an attacker. Based on the advice of experts in personal safety. Narrated by Shirley Jones.
